title: Center vs. Geogrotesque: a little too close for comfort
content:
Hmmmm:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/125217_6469.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/30017_5638.png)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/signal/center/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/signal/center/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/signal/center/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/geogrotesque/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/geogrotesque/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/geogrotesque/")

I dunno honey childs but Center and Geogrotesque are a little too close to me for one not to be a copy of the other... discuss [politely] amongst yourselves.

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
We should also consider the designers past works. In this case both of them have previously published quite original fonts and it's true, there are similarities, but I have a feeling that each designer had a different philosophy when creating these fonts.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sg_4802.gif)
David Bowie: “It is hard enough to be clever, you don’t have to be original.”

Here is an overlay comparison of [Geogrotesque Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/geogrotesque/) (Eduardo Manso, 2008; in green ) and [Center Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/signal/center/) (Max Phillips, 2013; in black). Both samples are screenshots from MyFonts. I have adjusted the spacing of Center to match Geogrotesque. The image is wider than the column, but I leave it the way it is, so that you can judge for yourself at the full resolution:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803044513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/geogrotesquecenter_4926.png)
